title: Improve compile error for borrowing mut while missing Sized trait bound

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

labels.name: D-terse
labels.description: A diagnostic that doesn't give enough information about the problem at hand

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->


Given the following [code](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=26d81fb56dbc4f01b3a3da064b737f7b): 

```rust
trait Modify {
    fn modify(&mut self) ;
}

impl<T> Modify for T  {
    fn modify(&mut self)  {
        // ...
    }
}

trait Foo {
    fn mute(&mut self) {
        self.modify();
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```
self.modify();
^^^^^^^^^^^^^ cannot borrow as mutable
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
the size for values of type `Self` cannot be known at compilation time
```

add `Sized` trait bound and the code compiles successfully:

```rust
trait Modify {
    fn modify(&mut self) ;
}

impl<T> Modify for T  {
    fn modify(&mut self)  {
        // ...
    }
}

trait Foo: Sized {
    fn mute(&mut self) {
        self.modify();
    }
}
```

rust version:  rustc 1.58.0 (02072b482 2022-01-11)
